data.name: ApproxOneNarcoberryEvery
data.value: That is approx. one Narcoberry every

data.name: btImportLastExportedTT
data.value: Import the creature-file that was exported last (ingame with the "Export Data"-function

data.name: btnGenerateUniqueNameTT
data.value: Generate automatic name Right-click to edit the pattern.

data.name: btReadValuesFromArkTT
data.value: Perfom an OCR on the opened inventory of a creature ingame. To use this feature you have to enable OCR in the settings and load a ocr-config-file which is made for your screen-resolution in the OCR-tab.

data.name: cbExactlyImprintingTT
data.value: Check this if you have exactly 100% imprinting. Usually enabling this setting is not needed and will prevent any extraction.

data.name: cbGuessSpeciesTT
data.value:
If checked, the tool will try to guess the species after reading the values from ARK with OCR. If the tool recognizes the species-name it will take that, otherwise it will check if the stat-values match a certain species.
Uncheck this if the tool repeatedly selects the wrong species after OCR (you have to choose it manually then).

data.name: cbQuickWildCheckTT
data.value: Check this if you just want a quick check of the levels of a wild (untamed) creature. The levels are then shown without the extraction-process (and without validation).

data.name: copyToMultiplierTesterToolStripButtonTT
data.value: All the levels, TE and IB from the Tester, and the stat-values from the Extractor will be copied to the Stat-Multiplier-Tester

data.name: domLevelExplanation
data.value: Levels assigned manually to this stat after the creature was domesticated

data.name: FoodHasToDropUnits
data.value: Food has to drop by {0} units.

data.name: issueMaxWildLevelTooLow
data.value:
The extraction is potentially possible, but it seems the max wild level is set too low for a valid extraction. Check if you set the correct value in the settings. The current value is {0} and this creature seems to have a higher wild level than this.
For other reasons of the failing of the extraction, see the list on the right after closing this messagebox.

data.name: lbImprintedCountTT
data.value: Number of cuddles given to get to this Imprinting-Bonus. Click left to set to the closest valid integer. Click right to set the imprinting to the value so for the torpor the levels in the tester and the value in the extractor match.

data.name: lbImprintingCuddleCountExtractorTT
data.value: Number of cuddles given to get to this Imprinting-Bonus.

data.name: lbListeningTT
data.value: red: listening, grey: deactivated, green: recognized, orange: didn't recognized Say "[species] [level]", e.g. "Rex level 30" or "Brontosaurus 50" to get taming-infos in the overlay

data.name: lbNameTT
data.value: Click to copy the name to the clipboard, e.g. for pasting it in the game.

data.name: lbNotYetTamed
data.value: *Creature is not yet tamed and may get better values then.

data.name: lbOwnerTT
data.value: Click to toggle if the OCR can change the owner-field. Enable it if the OCR doesn't recognize the owner-name correctly and you want to add multiple creatures with the same owner.

data.name: lbPedigreeEmpty
data.value: Select a creature in the Library to see its pedigree here.

data.name: lbSumDomSBTT
data.value: This is the number that the sum of all manual levelups should be equal to.

data.name: lbSumDomTT
data.value: This is the sum of all manual levelups of this creature, it should exactly match the number below. If it's not matching, click on a stat that is yellow and choose another possible level distribution.

data.name: lbSumWildTT
data.value: This is an indicator if the sum of the wild levels is valid. If a number with a plus sign is shown, the sum is too high and you need to choose another possibility from the lists of yellow stats.

data.name: lbTestingInfo
data.value: Preview or edit levels of a creature.

data.name: lbTribeTT
data.value: Click to toggle if the OCR can change the tribe-field. Enable it if the OCR doesn't recognize the tribe-name correctly and you want to add multiple creatures with the same tribe.

data.name: notEnoughFoodToTame
data.value: Not enough food to tame the creature!

data.name: runDefaultExtractionAndImportFileToolStripMenuItem
data.value: Run default Extraction and import file

data.name: TimeUntilFeedingAllFood
data.value: Time until you can feed all needed food in one go

data.name: TimeUntilTorporDepleted
data.value: Time until max torpor is depleted

data.name: toolStripButtonDeleteTempCreatureTT
data.value: Delete currently selected data of the temporary creature

data.name: toolStripButtonSaveCreatureValuesTempTT
data.value: Save entered values until extraction-issue is resolved. This creature cannot be used in other parts of this application until it is properly extracted.

data.name: topPercentileLevel
data.value: This level is in the top {0} % of what you can find.

data.name: WarningMoreStarvingThanFood
data.value: Careful: this creature could have not enough food, so you might have to feed it before this time to prevent it from starving (check its inventory)!

data.name: wildLevelExplanation
data.value: Wild levels, which are considered for breeding

data.name: AlreadyCreatureWithTopStats
data.value: There is already a creature in your library that has all the available top-stats with the current set filters ({0} {1}). The currently selected conservative-breeding-mode might show some suggestions that may seem non-optimal. Change the breeding-mode to "Best next generation" for better suggestions.

data.name: BPsomePairingsAreFilteredOutMutations
data.value: Some pairs could be filtered out due to their mutations.

data.name: BPsomeCreaturesAreFilteredOutTags
data.value: Some creatures are filtered out due to their tags.

data.name: BPTopStatsShownMightNotTotalTopStats
data.value: The top-stats shown here might not be the top-stats of your entire library.

data.name: btBPJustMatedTT
data.value: Click to create an incubation-entry in the Raising-tab

data.name: cbBPTagExcludeDefaultTT
data.value: Check if all creatures should be excluded and only be included when have the include-mark on their tag. If this checkbox is unchecked, all creatures will be included by default, and only excluded if one of their tags has the exclude-mark and none has the include-mark.

data.name: lbBPBreedingScoreTT
data.value: The Breeding-Score of a pairing is not comparable to the Breeding-Score of another breeding-mode. The numbers in the different modes are generated in incompatible ways.

data.name: NoPossiblePairingForSpeciesFound
data.value: No possible pairings found for {0}. Make sure at least one female and male are available in your library and that you didn't exclude all possible creatures via the tag-selector.

data.name: nudBPMutationLimitTT
data.value: Consider only creatures with at most this many mutations. Set to -1 for any number of mutation.

data.name: ProbabilityForBest
data.value: Probability for this Best Possible outcome

data.name: rbBPHighStatsTT
data.value: Check for best next-generation-results. The chance for an overall good creature is better. Check if it's not important to have a Top-Stats-Offspring.

data.name: rbBPTopStatsCnTT
data.value: Combine top stats steady Check for best long-term-results and if you want to go safe. This mode will get to the best possible offspring steady and surely. Some offsprings might be worse than in High-Stats-Mode, but that's the mode you go if you want to have that perfect creature in some generations.

data.name: rbBPTopStatsTT
data.value: Combine top stats lucky Check for best long-term-results and if you're feeling lucky. It can be faster to get the perfect creature than in the Top-Stat-Conservative-Mode if you're lucky. Some offsprings might be worse than in High-Stats-Mode, but you also have a chance to the best possible offspring.

data.name: SelectSpeciesBreedingPlanner
data.value: Select a species to see suggestions for the chosen breeding-mode

data.name: lbImprintingFailInfo
data.value: If the creature is imprinted the extraction may fail because the game sometimes "forgets" to increase some stat-values during the imprinting-process. Usually it works after you put the creature in and out of a cryopod, up- and download it in an obelisk/terminal, go out of render-distance, or wait for a server-restart.

data.name: speciesNotTameable
data.value: The selected species is not tameable. Maybe you have selected a non-tameable variant of a tameable species?

data.name: cbBPMutationLimitOnlyOnePartner
data.value: One partner may have more mutations

data.name: useFilterInTopStatCalculation
data.value: Use filter in top stat calculation

data.name: onlyCreaturesWithThisColor
data.value: Only creatures that have this color

data.name: filterAllNeededInfo
data.value: Only creatures with all of these flags will be displayed

data.name: filterExcludeInfo
data.value: Creatures with this flag will not be shown

data.name: filterOneNeededInfo
data.value: Only creatures with one of these flags will be displayed

data.name: issueCauseTypo
data.value: Double check if all stat-values are entered correctly.

data.name: issueCauseWildTamedBred
data.value: Make sure the correct state (wild, tamed, bred) for the creature is chosen.

data.name: issueCauseTamingEffectivenessRange
data.value: Taming-Effectiveness-Range too narrow, increase the upper and / or decrease the lower bound.

data.name: issueCauseLockedDomLevel
data.value: Uncheck all Lock-to-Zero-buttons in the stats (all lock-symbols should be green and opened).

data.name: issueCauseImprintingLocked
data.value: You locked the imprinting-value by checking "Exactly, don't adjust" and the tool won't adjust it, this may cause the extraction to fail.

data.name: issueCauseImprintingNotUpdated
data.value: Sometimes the game doesn't update the stat-value after an imprinting. Try the extraction after the creature was cryoed again.

data.name: issueCauseImprintingNotPossible
data.value: The imprinting-percentage given is not possible with the current multipliers and may cause wrong values during the extraction-process. Make sure the BabyCuddleIntervallMultiplier and the BabyMatureSpeedMultiplier are set correctly. They may have to be set to the value when the creature hatched/was born, even if they were changed.

data.name: issueCauseSingleplayer
data.value: If you have enabled the Singleplayer-Settings in the game, make sure the according checkbox is enabled in the settings in this application as well.

data.name: issueCauseWildLevelSteps
data.value: Adjust or disable the "Consider Wild-level - steps" in the settings.

data.name: issueCauseMaxWildLevel
data.value: The maximal wild level is set too low, go to the settings and adjust it.

data.name: issueCauseStatMultipliers
data.value: The stat multipliers in the Settings are not set to the multipliers of the server. Ask your admin for the correct multipliers and adjust them in the Settings.

data.name: issueCauseOutdatedIngameValues
data.value: The stats of the creature were changed recently and the game displays the old values. Level up a stat, that should trigger a recalculation of the values.

data.name: issueCauseCreatureLevel
data.value: Check if the total level of the creature is entered correctly. If the creature is bred, also check if the BabyImprintingStatScaleMultiplier is set correctly.

data.name: issueCauseArkStatIssue
data.value: This species is known to show wrong stat values ingame, this can prevent a successful extraction.

data.name: BtSaveOTSPresetTT
data.value: Save Owner, Tribe and Server as preset. The preset can be applied by the Apply Preset button

data.name: BtApplyOTSPresetTT
data.value: Set the values for owner, tribe and server from the saved preset

data.name: holdCtrlForRandomColors
data.value: Hold Ctrl for random natural colors Hold Ctrl + Shift for random colors

data.name: BtBeepFailureTT
data.value: This sound is played when an automatic import failed, manual selection of levels may be needed.

data.name: BtBeepSuccessTT
data.value: This sound is played when an automatic import succeeded

data.name: BtBeepTopTT
data.value: This sound is played when a level of the imported creature is a top stat, i.e. equal to the current highest level in the library

data.name: BtBeepNewTopTT
data.value: This sound is played when an automatic imported creature has a higher level in a stat than all other creatures of that species in the library

data.name: downloadingValuesSuccess
data.value: Downloading and updating of the new species-stats was successful.

data.name: valuesFileLoadingError
data.value: The species values-file couldn't be loaded, this application does not work without. Try redownloading the tool.

data.name: noValidExtractedCreatureToExport
data.value: There is no valid extracted creature to export.

data.name: noCreatureSelectedInLibrary
data.value: There are no creatures in the library selected to copy to the clipboard.

data.name: VariantSelectorInfo
data.value: Species that contain one variant that is unchecked will be hidden.

data.name: ExportFolderDetectionFailed
data.value: The export folder for exported creatures couldn't be detected automatically.

data.name: issueCauseModValues
data.value: If the creature is from a mod, you may need to enable the according mod values in Settings - Mod value manager.

data.name: extractionFailedHeader
data.value: The extraction failed. See the following list of possible causes

data.name: Collection changed discard and load?
data.value: Your Creature Collection has been modified since it was last saved, are you sure you want to discard your changes and load the file without saving first?

data.name: Discard changes and load file
data.value: Discard changes and load new library

data.name: Collection changed discard and quit?
data.value: Your Creature Collection has been modified since it was last saved, are you sure you want to discard your changes and quit without saving?

data.name: Collection changed discard and new?
data.value: Your Creature Collection has been modified since it was last saved, are you sure you want to discard your changes and create a new Library without saving?

data.name: Discard changes and new
data.value: Discard changes and create new library

data.name: ToolStripLabelFilterTT
data.value: Filters the library. Multiple search words are separated by commas. Considered are the creature's Name Owner Tribe Note Ark id in game Server Tags Filter for a stats with {statAbb} [==|<|>] {value}, e.g. hp > 20, st == 35 Filter for colors with c{regions}: {colorValue} {colorValue2}, e.g. c0: 20, c5: 3 4 5 6, c1: 13 14 It's also possible to filter for creatures with a color in one of multiple possible regions. E.g. to display all creatures with the color 10 or 20 in any region use: c0 1 2 3 4 5: 10 20

data.name: ClickDisplayFile
data.value: Click to show file in explorer

data.name: maxLevelForLevelUp
data.value: max level that allows domestic levelups

data.name: maxLevelSaved
data.value: max wild level that will be saved

data.name: ultraMaxLevel
data.value: Warning: The level is higher than the possible max value and will not be saved.

data.name: issueCauseImpossibleTe
data.value: The level results in an impossible taming effectiveness. Did you enter the levels arbitrarily? It might work if you set the creature to bred.

data.name: lbServerTT
data.value: Click to toggle freezing this field. If the field is frozen its background is grey and importing a creature won't update this field.

data.name: LbAlternativeColor
data.value: Hold Ctrl to select an alternative color id (red border). Hold Ctrl and click on No Color to unset it.

data.name: nameAlreadyExistsInLibrary
data.value: This name already exists in the library
